530-d-11-27-01-WACR.Narrative: CREW X803E WERE MOVING CARS SOO 5126, BBRX 2008 AND BBRX 2005 FROM INTERCHANGE WITH THE NECR TO THEBOMBARDIER PLANT IN WEBSTERVILLE, VT.  WHEN BBRX 2005 THE TRAILING CAR IN THE CONSIST DERAILED.  FOLLOWING OUR INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE FOLLOWING WERE THE CONTRIBUTING CAUSES OF THE DERAILMENT.  RECENT SURFACING OF THE TANGENT AND CURVES IN THE AREA, EFFECTIVELY CHANGING THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THE TRACK.  SOME MARGINAL TIES IN THESE AREAS AND THE SHORT DISTANCE BETWEEN THE TRUCK CENTERS OF TWO POWER CARS COUPLED BACK TO BACK.  NOT ALLOWING FULL ARTICULATION OFTHE TWO UNITS.  CAUSED EXCESSIVE PRESSURE ON THE RAIL AND IN COMBINATION WITH THE ABOVE-MENTIONED TRACK CONDITIONS CAUSED THE GAUGE TO SPREAD AND THE WHEELS TO CLIMB THE RAIL DERAILING THE POWER UNIT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

111501-d-11-15-01-ACEX.Accident Cause: Highway user cited for violation of highway-rail grade crossing traffic laws
111501-d-11-15-01-ACEX.Narrative: THE RR CROSSING ACCIDENT OCCURRED WHEN A GRAVEL TRUCK STOPPED IN FRONT OF A CLOSED GATE TO THE VULCAN MATERIALS COMPANY.  THE DRIVER LEFT HIS TRUCK TO INQUIRE AS TO WHY THE GATE WAS CLOSED, AWARE THATHIS REAR TRAILER WAS STILL ON THE RAILROAD TRACK.  AFTER PASSING MP 45.1 THE ENGINEER ON ACE 05 NOTICED A TRUCK ON THE CROSSING.  AT THAT TIME HE THROTTLED OFF TO IDLE AND BEGAN BLOWING THE HORN ANDAPPLYING THE BRAKE.  THE DRIVER WHO WAS ARGUING WITH THE GATE GUARD WAS TOLD THAT A TRAIN WAS COMING, GOT BACK IN HIS TRUCK AND THEN LEFT HIS TRUCK BEFORE THE ACCIDENT.  AT 2000 FEET THE ENGINEER SOUNDED THE EMERGENCY HORN AND APPLIED THE EMERGENCY BRAKE.  THE TRAIN SLOWED TO APPROXIMATELY 40 MPH THEN STRUCK THE TRUCK ON THE CENTER OF THE REAR TRAILER.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED AT THE SCENE, HOWEVER SEVERAL PASSENGERS LATER CLAIMED TO HAVE HAD WHIPLASH-TYPE INJURIES.  AN INJURY DUE TO THIS INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO ACEX ON 1/22/02.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
